website_summaries.verdict: From a reputable company, this high-quality item is dependable and easy to use. The best available.
cons: A brief history of faulty spin mechanisms (problem has been corrected)

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work well at all.
customer_reviews.text: My lettuce is still wet and ends up limp. This seems to be a poor quality spinner. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JTG

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T DRY GREENS!
customer_reviews.text: This spinner does NOT dry greens!!!! Even after spinning twice you absolutely have to use lots of paper towels and even that doesn't do the trick. VERY DISSATISFIED! USELESS. Have had it for months and have tried using it different ways. Will give up and buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... all the reviews and this is what was the best one the reviews said so
customer_reviews.text: We read all the reviews and this is what was the best one the reviews said so....NOT. We thought at first it was ok but after 5 months of frustration and constantly spinning and spinning our lettuce only to have it wet always, we are returning it. I am hoping we can still return it because it was the most expensive one too!
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Basket is definitely smaller - still happy though
customer_reviews.text: Literally 1/16 of an inch smaller bowl, but the basket is noticeably smaller by at least a 1/2 inch. (It fits inside the old basket) We use this spinner every day, and it was starting to disintegrate and was severely discolored. The new "redesigned by China" model spins smoothly and as fast as expected. Seems a bit easier to pump, and quieter - but that could just be the age of our old one. Overall we are pleased with the spinner - the price point is a bit high for a Chinese made product hence one star removed.
customer_reviews.author: ONightbird

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design
customer_reviews.text: The spinner mechanism extends deeply and massively into the center of the bowl. You must arrange the lettuce neatly around the outside before placing the top on. And it never spins fast enough to really extract the water. OXO had one job in designing this thing - they did it poorly.
customer_reviews.author: Nire

customer_reviews.title: This makes that easy. Take it from a guy who believes salad ...
customer_reviews.text: Never heard of these before my wife asked me to get one. Now? Makes salad prep so much easier. Even 'pre-washed' salad mixes are suggested to at least rinse before use. This makes that easy. Take it from a guy who believes salad is his food's food, but now has to eat it. This makes it simple. Can even store the salad in this in the fridge for a while. Hmm, internal strainer might even work for macaroni.... Alright, now I am hungry. Cya! And get one of these if you don't have one.
customer_reviews.author: Steven LoBue

customer_reviews.title: I bought this spinner a couple years ago based on ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this spinner a couple years ago based on its high reviews. I use it frequently, but I can't wait for something to break so I can get another brand or model. The push top produces just enough centrifugal force to rid lettuce leaves of excess water, but not enough force to significantly dry the lettuce. There is still too much moisture left on the leaves. I usually have to complete drying with a paper towel. And the squeaking!! There is a high pitched squeak as the colander spins.
customer_reviews.author: Mothra

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work Like It Used To!
customer_reviews.text: Not like the good old days! I had an old Oxo salad spinner for years that was so perfectly balanced that if you could get it up to speed it would keep going. This new one, which I purchased because the old one finally broke, is clunky and poorly balanced. I don't know where it is made (well, yes, I can guess), but it is a poorer replica of the old one. We also have a Zyliss that is works via pull string and is more finely balanced. I would only hope someone at Oxo will read this and look into what I can only call manufacturing degradation.
customer_reviews.author: A Connecticut Reader

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product.
customer_reviews.text: Greatest salad dryer out there. This was the America's Test Kitchen pick. Don't waste your money on the cheaper ones.I know, I bought one of those first and it gives me a headache every time. This makes short work of completely drying any greens. The pump action is SO much better than the handle spinner types. This never comes apart mid spin and gets your greens and veggies totally dry. Spend the money and save yourself the aggravation and wasted money on a salad dryer that doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: C Clauser

customer_reviews.title: Worst salad spinner ever!
customer_reviews.text: This spinner is horrible! It's way too large and too heavy to manipulate easily. The "push down" pump never speeds up, regardless of how often you push it. It does NOT get the lettuce close to dry even after multiple attempts, draining the water, and fluffing the lettuce. The two tops regularly stick together and are a pain to divide. Overall, I wish I had never bought this item, never mind having paid such a high price for it! I tried to return it, but it would have cost me another $20 to do that and I'd end up with no spinner at all.
customer_reviews.author: paula whiting

customer_reviews.title: This is another mediocre oxo product.
customer_reviews.text: Why do people buy these things and why do they buy them for me? This product is unnecessarily large. It takes a lot of room in the cabinet. The actual spinning capacity is no better than smaller models of other brands. The basket itself is larger than other brands, but the oxo spinning mechanism is a cylinder which sticks into the middle of the spin basket. So the potential for you smashing your greens with the spinning element is really good. The cover is also very confusing to clean. It looks like water and cleaning solution can get inside the spinning mechanism thingy and there are crevices which are difficultTo get a sponge on. I do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: B. D. Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use!
customer_reviews.text: It's super wide and operates simply with pushing down on the big green pump with your hand. It's not tiresome at all and there's a little stopper you press when you want it to stop spinning. I don't use it for salads but I have found a great use for them- drying out my chickpeas! If you want some great roasted chickpeas, you have to make sure they're dry before you put them in the oven. I can rinse them in the same colander and cleanup is a breeze. Great buy and I've had great use out of this.
customer_reviews.author: MissM

customer_reviews.title: Bad Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to write a bad review but very disappointed with this item - leaves lettuce with water still on leaves - not dripping but just enough to make the salad limp regardless of how much I put in the container to spin OR how many times I spin. My $5 hand spinner from WM works so much better - a total waste of money - but is sturdily made - can use as a salad bowl which I do not need. This item does not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Lady

customer_reviews.title: I like the design but the functionality is severely lacking
customer_reviews.text: I like the design but the functionality is severely lacking. My last salad spinner was 1/3 the price and recently bit the dust, so I thought maybe it was time to splurge on a new one. Unfortunately, the push button will only spin the basket so fast and you can't push it more to make it any faster. I had to push pretty hard on the stop button to get it to stop quickly, which I thought might get the lettuce drier as well. After 6+ sessions of spinning, my lettuce was still much wetter than it was with 3 spins on my old spinner.
customer_reviews.author: darcey55

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I've owned an OXO salad spinner for maybe 10 years, if not more. When it broke, it owed me nothing, so I immediately bought a new one. The top of this one came apart in 2 months! I did nothing different, it is just a shoddy piece of workmanship. I wonder if all those positive reviews aren't for when it was just purchased. Works well initially. But it is junk. I am going to buy another brand's salad spinner.
customer_reviews.author: DSS

customer_reviews.title: SO Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this salad spinner! It has become an essential item in my kitchen. I can now easily throw together a salad very quickly. I've used it for rinsing and spinning a variety of lettuces, and they all have come out beautifully clean and crisp. I've also used the spinner for cherry and grape tomatoes as well as berries. I am definitely eating more salad now than I was before... The prep is SO much simpler with this spinner. The spinner is the size of a large salad bowl, and it does take up space in the kitchen. I made room for it on my utility cart, though, because it is well worth it to have it handy.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use = A; Salad drying ability = B
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint about this salad spinner, is that the spinner only spins so fast. Once you hit it's speed limit, there seems to be no way to make it go faster. As a result, your salad will still have a light coating of moisture after spinning. Short of fluffing and redistributing your lettuce after an initial spin, there seems to be no way to get the salad as dry as with other spinners I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: S. Citron

customer_reviews.title: We have had this Salad Spinner for less than five ...
customer_reviews.text: We have had this Salad Spinner for less than five months and the top part is not working properly. A little plastic part on the inside of the top (which cannot be reached) broke off. As a result, the black button that you press on will not stop the spinner from spinning. You now have to wait quite a while for it to stop on its own which is not how the top is supposed to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Evarts

customer_reviews.title: hate the new design
customer_reviews.text: I had the older model for years until I dropped the bowl and it cracked. I wish I would have saved the spinner because this one is junk! To keep the push top down the slide lock now has a small yellow rubber stopper that needs to be put in behind it to keep it in place. Then it has to be removed for spinning and replaced again to keep the top down. Why the extra part? Despite trying to be careful, I lost the little yellow rubber "lock" and now the top won't stay down. The entire top also comes apart too easily. What's the old saying? "If it ain't broke; don't fix it!"
customer_reviews.author: Susan Grace

customer_reviews.title: Who would've thunk?
customer_reviews.text: I never knew I could get so much joy from a simple kitchen item. This salad spinner has made me actually want to eat more salads because they taste fresher and I can enjoy the actual leaves without the extra wetness. It is super easy to operate, just put the salad in and spin, no turning and doesn't require a lot of arm strength. My favorite part, its super easy to clean! I would def recommend it to anyone who is in the market for one.
customer_reviews.author: DesDotCom

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Ease of Use I Expect from OXO
customer_reviews.text: This is my second OXO Salad Spinner. My ex-wife kept the first one when we divorced, and I don't blame her--it's a handy tool! This newest model is built even more ruged than the first. The bowl, as well as the spinning basket inside, are made of a thicker gauge of plastic. The old one flexed and felt a little more flimsy. Of the different styles of spinners I've tested, rip cords, pedal, or spinning handle, this pumping action spinner is the easiest to use. I give it 5-stars in all categories. OXO clearly puts thought into every product that bears their name.
customer_reviews.author: OK, Cliff!

customer_reviews.title: Very useful kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting one for a long time, and finally got around to buying it. Generally, I think single purpose kitchen tools are a waste of money, but this is an exception. If you use greens or herbs often, it's well worth the money. I've probably spent that much already using paper towels in the past. It has saved me a lot of time as well.If you want encouragement to eat more salads, this helps. It's simple and fun to use, and it removes excess water very well. I really like it for herb prep--it speeds up the process for things like cilantro chutney, basil pesto, chimichurri, especially since it can hold a good amount.
customer_reviews.author: Artemis

customer_reviews.title: so disappointing
customer_reviews.text: After all the stellar reviews, I was excited to replace my broken spinner with an Oxo. I tried this for 2 months before I finally gave up. Maybe I'm doing something wrong (but it's hard to imagine when it's so simple to use). It leaves my lettuce wet no matter how long I spin it. I've just purchased a Zyliss pull-string type salad spinner (like my old one). It's so much better!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought it three years ago...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been fiddling around for at least three years, looking for the best salad spinner. I did look at this one originally, but thought it was a little expensive for a single use item. However, I HATE washing salad greens and waiting hours for them to dry, sitting on a towel on the counter. After looking at every salad spinner online and in every store, I came back to this one. It’s close to perfect. Only minor downside is the large size, but it works so well, I’m happy to give up the cupboard space.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Salad Spinner!!!
customer_reviews.text: After doing a lot of reading and internet researching I purchased this salad spinner with a lot of trepidation. The price is what scared me, especially since it is made of plastic. So glad I went where my research recommended! This is NOT an ordinary plastic salad spinner. This thing is quality! After unboxing and a very thorough inspection I’m pleased to say that I’m very satisfied with my purchase. All of the pieces are very thick plastic and very well made. All in all I believe this salad spinner will last a very long time. It is definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: More than a salad spinner
customer_reviews.text: Originally I bought this for what it is: a salad spinner. I have a small spinner purchased years ago but doing everything in small batches was time consuming. It was time to get something larger. This spinner has proven to be so much more than a salad spinner. The colander and bowl are very handy for washing and rinsing my homegrown swiss chard, larger greens, and tomatoes. The bowl is clear plastic (Lucite?) and could easily serve as a salad bowl for a layered salad. This was definitely a worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Garden Cat

customer_reviews.title: Our local spinach is quite dirty when we buy it
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this salad spinner for awhile now and don't know how I lived without one before. It is a bit bulky to store, but that should be obvious. It works well for lettuce, kale and other green leaf items, but we also use it for spinach. Our local spinach is quite dirty when we buy it. We use the bottom bowl to soak the spinach and allow the dirt to wash off and sink to the bottom. Then we transfer the spinach from the bowl to the strainer and spin it dry.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Slow spin
customer_reviews.text: I had the original for several years and it worked fine. When it broke, I purchased this latest model. After taking the top apart for washing I was unable to get the top to fit into the bottom properly. After inspecting, we realized the circular top isn't' fitting into the bottom because the bottom section has a bit of an odd shape which prevents the top from fitting properly, resulting in a very slow and clumsy spin. Reasonable price if it works. Unfortunately, I'm back to rinsing greens in a bowl with a veg wash, rinsing and drying with paper towels.
customer_reviews.author: BeeReel

customer_reviews.title: Bad purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just does not work. It is the worst spinner I have ever had. And the most expensive. I read so many reviews and took advice from Americas Test Kitchen thinking this was a good product but does not remove any water from salad greens. It doesn’t spin fast enough to. It was a very bad purchase, but due to an emergency I waited too long to get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cut the lettuce first!
customer_reviews.text: Mu old spinner finally bit the dust, we use for lettuce daily. I was not happy initially because although it looked like it was spinning like crazy, it did not dry the whole lettuce leaves. If you cut the lettuce up first and then use the spinner, it will get most of the water off. It has a big plastic piece that comes down in the middle of the spinner which reduces the amount of material you can put in, but I have gotten used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen L.

customer_reviews.title: Completely Fell Apart
customer_reviews.text: After 10 uses ... maybe ... it totally fell apart. The lid would not come off at first ... and then the whole lid and plunger fell to pieces. A real mess. Zero quality. I think that all I can do is throw it away. My previous salad spinner (which I still have but is a little small) is maybe 6 or 7 years old. My guess is that OXO's quality control is no longer a priority. .
customer_reviews.author: michie

customer_reviews.title: Weak performance despite brand name
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a solid spinner to replace the super-spinner that I've had for probably 20 years (the bowl eventually cracked beyond repair - very bummed about that). Unfortunately, this one is way over-engineered with very little drying ability. The container is solid, the components seem solid, but the overall performance is weak. The "top" includes a drop-down component that takes up way too space in the salad container and inhibits the spinning function. It simply doesn't spin fast enough to actually dry the lettuce well. Good brand name but not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Adams

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but Not Easy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: The product is mostly sturdy plastic. The clear bowl is attractive for presenting salads. However, since it is plastic, we fear putting any oily salad dressing that could be absorbed by the plastic causing discoloration and retaining odor. The pop off lid doesn’t make a lot of sense and makes drying difficult. You still need to wash both parts of the lid as both parts are exposed to the salad (see pictures). The inner white plastic spindle has holes where water can get into but is extremely difficult to dry. This could lead to mold in the long run. It’s a large capacity but the spindle does take away some of the bowl space.
customer_reviews.author: Faja

customer_reviews.title: Lettuce is wet after spinning
customer_reviews.text: The pump action is easy to use and the bowl is large.. good quality., The problem is that I spin the lettuce and spin some more but the leaves are still wet!!
customer_reviews.author: View Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't dry lettuce enough
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old spinner I had with this oxo one. Unfortunately, it just doesn't work properly. You can't pump it fast enough to get the water to spin off. The inner plastic strainer is also really thick which is nice but it really holds the water in the holes making it difficult to get dry when cleaning. Not a great design. They will take it back but of course I am responsible for the shipping which I'm not sure makes it work returning as it will require a good size box.
customer_reviews.author: CandyGrinch

customer_reviews.title: It works ok, but not great
customer_reviews.text: It works ok, but it's not great or amazing. It works about the same as if you use a colander, and are patient with the colander, and let all of the water drip out slowly. It does not work better than that. If you're too impatient to wait for the water to fully drip out of a colander, then maybe this is for you. Otherwise, this is not a magic bullet, and it is not better than properly/patiently using a colander. Overall I think this product is over-hyped. On the plus side, it is also a very large bowl that is good for storing a large salad.
customer_reviews.author: NYUser83954

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is durable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this salad spinner in 2014. It is now 2020 and I still use it almost weekly. It has been one of the best purchases I have made on Amazon. I don't think anyone expects to still be using a plastic kitchen appliance 6 years after purchasing it with active use. That is the proof to the quality of this product. It is hardened plastic that does not bend or break if it falls on the floor. The stopping mechanism is a mechanical force to slow it down so there isn't anything to break there. I am very happy with this product's performance and highly recommend it! It is a great price and lasts forever.
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Works great and makes washing lettuce FUN!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was fooling myself that “if I buy a salad spinner I will eat more salads.” Well it’s true. This contraption is perfect. We buy a bag of romaine. I chop it up and stuff it all in the spinner. I fill It completely with water and swish around the lettuce. I lift out the basket and dump the water then do the same again. After dumping the second time I spin it. HARD. 2 or 3 times gets all the water. Then I lift the basket out and let it air dry a while. Put it all in a big tupperware and it lasts a week and stays crispy and delicious. Buy it!!
customer_reviews.author: Kayzee

customer_reviews.title: Very nice salad spinner
customer_reviews.text: These Oxy salad spinners are very nicely designed. They work well. I would give this a 5 star review, except this is the third one I've had to purchase over the years. The reason is because the two previous units eventually locked up and refused to spin any longer. This one looks a little different from the past ones I've purchased, so I'm unsure of whether they have fixed that quality issue; only time will tell. Mind you, past units did last for several years so I feel that I got my money out of them. This unit was more expensive that the past unit I purchased; hopefully that means they put more into the quality of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Massive size, easy to use, but too expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of the great reviews. I did a side by side comparison of this with my old $4 Ikea salad spinner. The Ikea spinner is harder to use but it can spin faster and get the lettuce a little drier. Also the OXO spinner is massive in size - takes more room to store it. Seems like it would be more suitable for institutions that use larger quantities of salad. Anyhow, I decided to return it and continue using the Ikea spinner until I can find an inexpensive substitute. The OXO has a good build quality but seems too large and expensive for the typical family.
customer_reviews.author: Larry from Tampa

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Reasonable Price, Needs proper care for long term
customer_reviews.text: I’m a chef so I’ve used a lot of salad spinners. This product is consistent with all the OXO salad spinners I have used and the quality I expect. I like how long it spins and extracts water and I don’t have to keep pushing the top over and over. For its size I wish I could fit more greens inside for the top to fit down but overall I’m happy with it and the price is reasonable. I don’t recommend putting it in the dishwasher, hand wash all the parts and dry separately so the plastic doesn’t warp and no mold forms in the nooks and crannies and it will last a long time
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Haak

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best manual spinner and I've had many different ones
customer_reviews.text: We have gone through about w other brands in the past 5 years that have broken or were difficult to spin or close properly. This spinner always engages properly. Others we have had look like they are ready to spin but don't spin and need to have the basket and top re seated. And the large push down spinning knob makes it very easy to spin. The spinning basket is made of thick plastic and is it's easy to wash. This spinner looks much sturdier than any we have previously owned. Hopefully it will last longer as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sureshot

customer_reviews.title: Mini laundry machine!!
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this for handwashing laundry, but I think if it can stand up to laundry use it will stand up to salads. It gets water out of the clothes really well and will spin very fast if you want it to. Easily the best part about it is that you can remove the basket, which makes it exceptionally easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Small things makes a big difference
customer_reviews.text: I have used many salad spinners before but this one is easily the best one. The size is just right and the top design makes it easy to store or put upside down to dry. The basket is sturdy and doesn't feel like it would break. Everything is dish washable which makes it easy to clean. The only slight downside I would say is you have to take things out to drain the water and the bowl still feels like it might break over long time use if you hold it by one side too often (I think there is a stainless steel version that would probably be perfect).
customer_reviews.author: andynd_reviews

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful salad spinner!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a while, but I am just now getting around to writing a review for it. I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this salad spinner. It does a GREAT job of spinning the lettuce. It is very well made. I feel like I made a really good choice in buying this salad spinner.
customer_reviews.author: S. McInnes

customer_reviews.title: It does not spin fast enough
customer_reviews.text: It's a beautiful product but it does not spin fast enough to dry the lettuce. The lettuce comes out wet. My 20 year old Oxo lettuce spinner worked great until a few weeks ago when it locked up but the new one is very slow.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Wet vegetables
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed when i used this and it did not spin the greens dry. I had to place paper towels in with the greens to get them dry and spine several times. I do like that it is easy to spine. I gave up on this spinner and returned it. I choose it because it was given a good rating by american Test Kitchen, but no matter how many times I would spin the greens, they were still wet. Maybe i just got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Dearsie W. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: America’s Test Kitchen recommended
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my brother to give to our mom for either her birthday or mother’s day a year or so ago and I think she still has it? I’m stationed across the country with the Navy from her so I don’t visit home too often, and I don’t remember ever seeing her use it but I think she liked it... either way, OXO is a great brand and I’m pretty sure America’s Test Kitchen is the one that recommended this spinner, so that’s all the vote I need to say it’s probabl good.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Nice to look at
customer_reviews.text: Lovely for a salad spinner, well made but really pricy and while I am NOT unhappy with this spinner (and I used gift certificate), I do think I could have done without it...but hey....didn’t cost ME any money, hehe. It does take up storage room, it is BIG. I just suggest this: how bad do YOU want a salad spinner.....
customer_reviews.author: North Carolina shopping chickTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Decent Salad Spinner
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying I eat a lot of salad/lettuce. I ordered this spinner in hopes that it would cut down on the time I spend spinning salad (I was using a manual spinner previously). The amount of salad the spinner holds is decent(same as my previous spinner) but I feel I’m spending more time spinning the same amount of lettuce. I’m sure if one was spinning a normal amount of lettuce this spinner would be fine, but if you meal prep lettuce for your week, a manual spinner may be a better bet. I did end up returning this product. Thanks for reading.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn & Mike

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could return it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a cheaper, crank-type spinner. Sadly it does no better than the cheap one. The greens are just as water soaked after spinning as before they go in. I've tried double spinning, loading less greens, loading more greens. I wash a weeks work of lettuce and store it in zipper bags with paper towels. By the end of the week, about half of it is too soggy to use. Unfortunately I missed the deadline so I'm not able to return this product. A big waste of 30 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Cherri T

customer_reviews.title: Good Salad Spinner
customer_reviews.text: I'm really glad I finally bought one of these. I make a lot of green mixes for my rabbit, and spinning the greens helps keep a new mix fresh throughout the week. I am a little disappointed with the lid, as it does not seal well and so I cannot store my greens in this container. It also doesn't fit as well in the fridge as some of our other containers, but the salad mixing mechanism works well and is easy to use. A little hard to clean but this doesn't get too terribly dirty anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Mike & Kim

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: As a raw vegan, I eat a lot of salads. With that said, the purchase was worth it to me. Whether it would be worth the extra money if I were, say, someone who only made a salad a week, I cannot say for sure. One thing is for certain, this is a good quality salad spinner. It is so stable that you don't have to hold on to it after you have begun the spinning process. I like the lock button as well to stop the spinning when I want. It's easy to clean and pleasant to use.
customer_reviews.author: Luna Bretzke

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality - expect a long life.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job as intended. Comes apart much better than our previous one (that broke). Easy to put into dish washer in pieces and let it get cleaned automatically. Pushing the plunger fast gets almost all the water out, but a little dampness is left on the salad. Not really an issue, but there is a "maximum speed" you can get with the plunger. All the parts are sturdy - none feel cheap or flimsy. Expect to get a long life out of this spinner.
customer_reviews.author: Connecticut Fan

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I own other OXO products and they all seem to be one of the best kitchen/household items I own. I had a cheaper salad spinner because I didn't want to spend $30 for one, But when my old one broke and after many years of my spouse complains what a pain the spin handles was, I purchased this OXO one. The press type is so much more useful, less effort, and simply better design. "What you pay is what you get" really fits the description for this item. I also love that the spin button stows inside, so it won't take up more space when it's stored.
customer_reviews.author: Amaz Shopper 223

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this thing! You can our colander and main bowl in dishwasher but I suggest hand washing the top part that makes it spin. This thing is AMAZING! Holds a BIG head of romaine and then some. And for me probably 2 iceberg heads. I love this thing! It keeps my salad crisp and cold and fresh. Used to, my salad would go bad in less than 4-5 days after washing cutting and storing. Now it keeps about a week. Never eating my salad any other way!!
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: A screwdriver should not be required to wash the dishes
customer_reviews.text: This thing is ridiculous. The second time we used it, two pieces of greens got stuck in the spinner mechanism. I tried to flush it several times but it stayed stuck. I didn’t want to leave it in there to rot, so my husband went online and learned how to open up the device to flush it out. But then after we put it back together again it would not spin. Unless you can figure out how to prevent any bits of lettuce from sneaking up into the spinner, this thing is garbage. It’s a bummer because the previous OXO model lasted over ten years.
customer_reviews.author: red84604

customer_reviews.title: Great for summer's fresh produce
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to assist with cleaning the fresh greens I was purchasing at the local farmers' market. It holds a lot of greens at one time - think a BIG salad for a family dinner group. I really like how the basket spins, and I feel like it removes most of the wash liquid from the produce. My only complaint would be that the basket is a little hard to clean (by hand), the grooves allow small pieces of the green to "hide" and makes them difficult to remove. Otherwise, it's a great addition to healthy eating.
customer_reviews.author: S. Malone

customer_reviews.title: I bought this after reading glowing reviews and the need ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading glowing reviews and the need for a larger salad spinner. I only rated it two starts since after getting a little "western" with it, the spinning mechanism quit working after it broke internally. As a 6'2 200+ pound impatient cooking enthusiast, I probably should have gone with a different style spinner that can handle the inner gorilla.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas M. Walker

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought one of these sooner
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase. Been using this the past few months and wish I had something like this sooner. Works great to clean and spin leafy greens. Didn't expect that the the actual device would make a great salad crisper too. Lettuce lasts longer if left in the spinner, almost 4/5 days, without wilting. Device is well made and easy to clean. Fits in the fridge too. Highly recommended if you want dry leafy greens : )
customer_reviews.author: bigpook

customer_reviews.title: Leaves greens WET / Does NOT dry greens
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this thing zero stars I would. If you were looking for something that dries lettuce, look somewhere else. There is nowhere near enough centrifugal force for this thing to be effective. I cannot believe it has such good reviews. Anyone giving this a good review has never had a decent salad spinner.
customer_reviews.author: CRJ

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Thick bowl, with the bottom a rubberized material incorporated into it - no tiny feet to fall off and get lost. Easily comes apart for the dishwasher, and stores with the plunger locked down. Brake works well, but if you are expecting a sudden stop, don't. Just have to remember to leave a "divot" in the middle of what you are going to spin dry to allow room for the mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: J Fernsten

customer_reviews.title: I love the pump spin, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, I love this spinner. I like the quality of the product & the ease of a pump spin versus a hand crank! The only improvement I see needed (and an important one); is making the slits larger so more water spins off the lettuce, etc... The lettuce leaves do not come out dry enough for me because I feel the slits are to narrow. I hope the company pays attention to my review. They have a great product that just needs a little tweak! I use this at least 3 times per week because we eat a lot of salad & vegetables. This version of a salad spinner is much better than a hand crank spinner!
customer_reviews.author: Wombee

customer_reviews.title: OXO never disappoints
customer_reviews.text: I bought a cheaper salad spinner a couple months ago, not realizing how much I would actually use it. It didn't last long. This OXO spinner, though it costs more, is well worth the extra money. I love the way its designed, and it works great. I should have bought the OXO earlier. Buying whole lettuce and cleaning it yourself is so much healthier than the bagged stuff. Highly recommend this OXO spinner.
customer_reviews.author: WBC

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I have bought a salad spinner. I was reluctant to even buy one because it seemed silly. But I am really glad I did. I have been growing my own lettuce, chard and beets. This has worked well in cleaning the leaves, and spinning them dry. The bowl is a good size. Its so interesting how much water actually gets spinned off the leaves. I would buy again if I needed two.
customer_reviews.author: jonna vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Supposed to spin the lettuce dry...it doesn’t
customer_reviews.text: This is a useless spinner. I had a Zyliss that lasted for years and it worked beautifully with a pull string that caused a very fast spinning. This one just doesn’t spin fast enough to be effective no matter how fast or hard I press the knob.
customer_reviews.author: DPal

customer_reviews.title: Well made, just not what I thought it was for
customer_reviews.text: I guess I was expecting a salad spinner to help coat my salad with dressing while it's spinning, but I guess it's really just to get moisture out and doesn't do more than that. This pretty much turned into a glorified bowl with built-in colander and we don't use it for what we thought we would. However, it's a really nice quality, holds a lot, and the spinner is easy to use and honestly kind of fun.
customer_reviews.author: ShellyBelle

customer_reviews.title: Essential
customer_reviews.text: My first oxo salad spinner broke after 13 years of use. I tried to live without one while I was researching what kind I should buy and felt completely disabled in the kitchen. They are essential to me. In the end I went with oxo again and I'm so glad. The improvements to the spinner are wonderful. There was a part on the lid that came loose but we were able to shake it back into place and it hasn't been a problem since. I've been using mine for three months. I use it 3-4 times a week washing herbs and greens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slightly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I like OXO products, so when my Pampered Chef salad spinner broke, I did my "Google research", checked/read reviews, and decided on this OXO product. After my couple of initial uses, I find the quality to be a less than I was expecting. PROS: The spinner top stores with the pump button recessed flat, and the inner part of top/lid, pulls off quickly for extra easy cleaning. CONS: The pump action plastic top, that activates the spinner action, feels cheap and flimsy. I'm using light handed pressure and it feels like it's going to break any second. I'm going to give it more time, but I honestly believe, there are much better similar products.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: It sure beats drying lettuce with paper towels!
customer_reviews.text: Bagged salad is OK...sometimes. But when I really want the freshest and crispest salad possible, I buy my own lettuce and go through the routine of washing and drying the leaves with paper towels. This works, but it's just too time consuming. This is my first salad spinner. As such, I have no other brand or model to compare it to. I've used it many times, and it easily builds up enough speed to dry the lettuce. Also, it's easy to clean, and I've had no problems. Would I buy it again? Yes, I would. It's much easier and faster than drying with paper towels!
customer_reviews.author: T. Day

customer_reviews.title: Handy for making the best salads
customer_reviews.text: This spinner does a very good job of getting the water off salad greens so dressings stay on them. The OXO model is very well constructed and a bit more substantial than many spinners out there. It works well, cleans up easily and stores as conveniently a anything kitchen gadget this size can. This one gets high marks.
customer_reviews.author: Phil M.

customer_reviews.title: A total letdown. Why so many good reviews?
customer_reviews.text: We are big salad spinner users and were completely disappointed with this item. We bought it based on so many good reviews. I can only imagine those people have never had a salad spinner before. This could not generate enough speed to get lettuce dry. A much better choice are the green crank handle ones.
customer_reviews.author: L.J.W.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Plastic Salad Spinner
customer_reviews.text: I was very resistant to buy this because I owned one several years ago and it did not last long. Like all the plastic spinners I've owned it was thin plastic. I wanted a stainless steel one this time hoping it would last longer, but the one I wanted was unavailable so I opted to try this one based on the reviews. I was pleasantly surprised when I opened the box and found this OXO spinner to made with thick, sturdy plastic. I do wish it would spin faster, but it works well enough. All-in-all, this OXO salad spinner is very good.
customer_reviews.author: J. Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great Salad Spinner
customer_reviews.text: OXO Good Grips Salad Spinner -Green Arrived in a timely manner, and it’s everything it states. The non-skid base on the outer bowl grips the countertop so it doesn’t move all over the place, and the spinning mechanism is smooth and spins fast to really get the water out. Its size is ample for cleaning enough chopped lettuce for two dinner salads, and I like the bright, cheerful green color. If I need another one some time, or want to gift one, this will be what I order.
customer_reviews.author: R. Findlay

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get it dry
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why, but no matter how hard I spin this, the lettuce leaves stay wet. I've had other salad spinners before and never had this problem. I'm wondering if there's not enough space between the colander and the sides of the bowl, so the water drains back into the colander. Maybe not, but something sure keeps the lettuce from spin drying.
customer_reviews.author: Lara Edwards

customer_reviews.title: The only good one I’ve ever found.
customer_reviews.text: Somewhere in a landfill there are about 5 salad spinners I’ve bought over the years that weren’t worth a darn. Happy to report this is staying with me. It’s sturdy, it has a non-slip bottom and a brake. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: hapdyldrew

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been my whole life?!
customer_reviews.text: No more soup like dressing at the bottom of your bowl. This thing works and is super fun to use. We are now using it every single day. Do yourself a favor and buy this, is worth every penny. Typical great quality from OXO.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: Design doesn't dry well
customer_reviews.text: Does not dry the lettuce! Very disappointed. Don't buy. I had a previous lettuce dryer that I had had for 20+ years & thought because of BPA I would get a new one. I'm sorry I threw the old one away before using the new one because the new design doesn't dry well. Lettuce is damp.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K Sandifer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have had several salad spinners and absolutely hated them. They were flimsy, wouldn’t spin if I put too much lettuce in, and hard to clean. I saw a review on America’s Test Kitchen and they gave this one high marks. I ordered it and agree, it’s absolutely great! The bowl is heavy duty, it effectively holds and spins dry a whole head of Romaine, and cleanup is a snap. I no longer dread making salads.
customer_reviews.author: hutch

customer_reviews.title: Super fun salad spinner!
customer_reviews.text: It's a salad spinner the size of a large mixing bowl with a colander that sits directly in it. The top lid sits right on the top and has a large button for spinning, a (semi?) lock, and a quick-stop "brake" button. Functional, stylish, and sturdy. It makes washing lettuce and other greens a fun task. Best of all, you can store your fresh washed greens right inside of it when you're done spinning - a nice touch. Overall, a great product that I would recommend. Blessings!
customer_reviews.author: A Branch

customer_reviews.title: Salad spinner and colander c-c-c-combo
customer_reviews.text: One of the great things about this salad spinner is that the inner piece can be used as a colander. Multi-use products are always a good idea. I accidentally bought the smaller one (more appropriate for herbs and smaller salads I guess) and exchanged it for this big boy. The "brake" isn't absolutely necessary but it's a very nice convenience to have when you want to work quickly. It's very easy to clean as the 2-part lid comes apart. And the feature that keeps the pump thing down is a space saver.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Greatly Improved!
customer_reviews.text: I broke my old Oxo spinner the other day by accidentally dropping the top on the floor resulting in the spinner handle breaking off. I just got my replacement spinner, and wow what a difference in the new version. No idea how old mine was, but the new one has a much sturdier base, and the spinning mechanism works so much better than the old one. Great product - held up well over the years - and the new version is even better! I use mine all the time :)!
customer_reviews.author: Rycomom

customer_reviews.title: Nice option just a bit bulky
customer_reviews.text: It is quite wide and large but does fit in a kitchen cabinet on a shelf. There’s not much room on the shelf left, however. That’s the only reason I gave it four stars instead of five. But you sure can fit a lot of lettuce in it. Your lettuce is still wet after use. Don’t think it makes it completely dry by any means. I typically add a paper towel to my lettuce container just soak up any extra moisture and that seems to do the trick. The lettuce last at least a week.
customer_reviews.author: Renee L. Welch

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a salad spinner for some time now because drying lettuce or herbs by hand is not a great time and I'm sometimes left with greens that are too wet. WELL NOT ANYMORE GUYS. I cannot believe I waited for so long. I dried off some fresh herbs from the garden and these bad boys had hardly any wetness to them. Like the cleanest and not sopping wet. I love that this has a stop button feature and that I don't have to crank it or anything. It is amazing and I shall never go another day without a salad spinner. 🙏❤
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: First Time Salad Spinner
customer_reviews.text: As the headline says, I have never used a salad spinner. Ah, well, not that I know the "remaining" stuff left on lettuce/herbs, etc., in the spinner they will go! This is a large capacity spinner so if you are like me and like to have a little leftover for lunch, etc., you will not be disappointed. It is extremely easy to use, is stable, and, very easy to clean. It is also multipurpose (strictly as a colander or a large serving bowl). Terrific spinner that is MORE THAN spinner. Another quality OXO product!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret B.

customer_reviews.title: really spins out water well
customer_reviews.text: Have had many different salad spinner over the years and use them almost daily as we have salad most evenings. My last OXO had for several years and it got hard to spin. Had to push down on it with lots of pressure. Wasn't sure if I needed a new one but went ahead and treated myself to this new one. Boy am I glad I did! This works so easily and I was immediately happy to dump my old one in the trash! It spins so easily and really drains out water so well.
customer_reviews.author: GG.Sib

customer_reviews.title: great for rinsing greens or other fruit and veggies
customer_reviews.text: It's one thing to rinse off your produce-it's another thing to get it completely dry . Oxo Good Grips does exactly that. It's easy to put together, easy to use and gets my salad greens perfectly dry so the dressing doesn't get watered down. I've used it every day and put it through the dish washer--still works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Roseanne M. Pickering

customer_reviews.title: Worst salad spinner ever
customer_reviews.text: Americas Test Kitchen stated this was the best on the market. Now I assume they must be connected to the manufacturer. Will never rely on their recommendation again. This spinner never gets up enough speed to push out the water, Even after three solid spins, lettuce is still soggy and must be dried another way. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is made well, but the deisgn is a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.text: The quality is really nice and the bowl and basket are nice and thick so they seem like they will last. The biggest issue I have, and I didn't think about this when buying it, is that there is a large housing under the lid for the piston/pump thing. If you fill up the bowl with salad, this will press down into the middle of it, making it difficult to close. If I buy another one of these, I will buy one with a lever or pull string so it does not take up room in the actual bowl.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pettinato

customer_reviews.title: Just Ok
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest here, you can get the same thing for less. I purchased this product after watching a youtuber use it on her channel. Spinning is activated by pushing down it - which is nicer on your hands. The spin dry doesn't get the lettuce perfectly dry but it isn't half bad. The worst thing about this purchase was how much of a wreck the "packaging" was when it arrived. I was surprised the item was still in one piece. There was no extra packaging, they just shipped it in the products own box and it barely held up. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Arroyo

customer_reviews.title: Super well made but Not an easy fast spinner,
customer_reviews.text: Very well crafted of sturdy design and materials. But the bottom line is that it just doesnt get up to the speed I was used to with my old cord pull unit. So it doesnt get things as dry or at least as quickly dry. You cant add speed by pushing the plunger a second time while it is spinning. You have to actually wait for it to stop or use the brake before you can spin again. This is a pain. I have recently learned to really pounce on the push button very hard and fast and Im getting better speed. I use the brake then to stop it and respin. Its been a learning curve.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Levinson

customer_reviews.title: Best spinner available!
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this OXO spinner the best you can buy it's very versatile too. Toss your already cut greens inside after washing them of course, and press down on the green plunger several times to start the spinning, within a few seconds you can pop the lid off and you've got clean and dry greens ready to eat! You can also add the rest of your favorites to the greens with a splash of dressing and give it a spin or two!
customer_reviews.author: RW44

customer_reviews.title: Must have for veggie lovers!
customer_reviews.text: This is my lifesaver when it comes to washing veggies. We make salad everyday and kimchi every month. The sand/dirt on veggies it takes so long to get them out.. after getting this i realized how much sand/dirt veggies have.. even green onions or leaks! If y'all love veggies like we do. This is a must have!
customer_reviews.author: Mhai Daily

customer_reviews.title: The BEST salad spinner EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had many lesser spinners, none of such excellent quality. Also... after I ordered, I found out 'Americas Test Kitchens' rates it their best choice as well! If you prepare any greens and have ever washed them, they do have some crud on them, I wash in water and about 1/4 cup white vinegar for a few minutes, rinse, spin, serve, enjoy. This spinner gets greens dryer than any spinner I've ever used, tho I still sqeeze some residual tap water out because I dont like my citys water. A kitchen essential.
customer_reviews.author: C. E.

customer_reviews.title: Dud.
customer_reviews.text: This item looks nice, but its ineffective. I chopped up my veggies for a salad, placed them in the spinner and for the life of me, I was unable to attain the speed required to actually shed the water off of the vegetables. I was very disappointed. I will never try another plunger mechanism, next time I'll go manual spin for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Salad Spinner is a Necessity!
customer_reviews.text: I love leafy greens and unfortunately, a few days ago, I dropped the smaller version of this spinner and the spring detached. I could not figure out how to get it to work again and since I had utilized it for several years, I thought it was time for a new one. I love this salad spinner! I think it is an excellent product. The larger one is certainly a better value than the smaller one, especially for $5 more.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Dry Greens!
customer_reviews.text: Maybe we just got a lemon, but we have had this product for less than a year and it does not work very well at all anymore. A plastic ring in the lid came loose. We are going to have to buy another salad spinner.
customer_reviews.author: susan cross

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I started a more veggie-inclusive diet I've always wanted a salad spinner and I don't know how I've managed until now. OXO makes great quality products which is why I opted for this brand. It's perfect. Easy to clean and works well. Stores as compact as it can possibly get with the button-lock.
customer_reviews.author: Hideyo

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well but has a couple deficiencies
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a good salad spinner and is fairly sturdy. I can't imagine breaking it like my last one. The one thing that was nice about my last one was the spinner handle allowed you to spin it at faster speeds whereas this one you have no other choice than to max out at the fastest rate you can press the button down over and over. Doesn't quite get as fast as other salad spinners but that is probably why it will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful to look at, not so beautiful to use
customer_reviews.text: I had my last salad spinner for 10 years, it finally saw its last day and I ordered this one. I was so excited to open my salad spinner when it arrived, I tried to use it, the cover broke, the water got trapped between the layers of the cover. It was a nightmare to pack and send back. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amy-Riva

product_meta.title: OXO Good Grips Salad Spinner, Green,Large
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Green Salad Spinner| Design:Spinner

A new spin on our classic design

Before the introduction of the OXO Good Grips Salad Spinner in 1998, crank or pull-tab salad spinners were considered high-end products. Some people even used the spin cycle of their washing machine to dry lettuce. Our easy-to-use Spinner transformed the tool into an everyday kitchen essential.

Nearly 20 years later, we revisited the Spinner to make some updates while keeping the top features and original inspiration: a children’s top. With a modern design that complements contemporary kitchens and an improved brake that stops on a dime every time, we think you’ll love our new spin on the classic design. Dry salad greens with a simple press of the soft, non-slip knob. The non-slip base keeps the bowl steady on the countertop, and the updated built-in brake button stops the Salad Spinner for unloading. The basket doubles as a colander, and the lid comes apart for easy cleaning.
feature_bullets: Easy, one-handed operation with patented pump mechanism and brake button
Soft, non-slip knob locks down for storage, and a non-slip ring and wide base keep bowl steady on countertop
Elegant, clear bowl is perfect for serving, and basket can be used separately as a colander
Clear, flat lid allows for convenient stacking when not in use, disassembles for easy cleaning, and parts are top-rack dishwasher safe and BPA Free
Capacity 6.22 qt bowl, 4.95 qt basket, Dimensions 10.5'' x 10.5'' x 6''

The OXO Better Guarantee: If you experience an issue with your OXO product, get in touch with us for a repair or replacement. We’re grateful for the opportunity to learn from your experience, and we’ll make it better.
